Posts.Content: Hi I asked for both removed when I had rt mastectomy but they said they wouldn't remove healthy boob  I have several biopsies on let breast I am waiting now for u/s again more worry. I do appreciate that cancer  can occur on scar so nothing is definite best wishes for Tuesday hope all goes well
Posts.Title: Terrified..MX on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Message went before I'd finished I am waiting for result of chest X-Ray trying not to worry but it's hard isn't it  Like you at one time before big c I wouldn't have give it a thought but to be honest my breathing hasn't been  Great since chemo 2yrs ago but after having this virus it's rubbish anyway onwards and upwards
Posts.Title: THANKYOU SO MUCH

Posts.Content: Good luck with new job London lass glad you are feeling better .
Posts.Title: THANKYOU SO MUCH

Posts.Content: Hi wombat I had mammogram in October 213 my breasts have always been painful but my RT one was very painful and I felt a lump in the following July dr said it was unluckily to be cancer because of pain but after biopsies they found 2lumps which were both tnbc they checked back to my mammogram of previous year and they said there was nothing there so mine had appeared in abut 7to8 months .there was a shadow on lt breast but that was cysts .dont keep blaming yourself look forward we can't change the past
Posts.Title: Was this the start?

Posts.Content: Went to debenhams they didn't have one post-op bra everything online I know most people use online more now but still know some what don't own iPhone etc it's annoying because you still have to go to be measured the girls I dealt with were very good and one especially couldn't understand why they didn't stock them but said they had a new manager who had mentioned restocking she said she would mention it at next meeting my size does vary at different stores I did order two bras and they are a good fit . I found asda bra good but not supportive enough .
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: My breasts were always lumpy and very sore at times . When I found my "lump" it was very painful and not round but like a long strip of thick tissue everyone said oh if it's painful it's ok think I knew it wasn't good I actually had two lumps in same breast this was 6months after clear mammogram as well . I say always get any change checked .
Posts.Title: finding lumps - some advice please

Posts.Content: Just sleep when you can keep fluids up to flush out I didn't start losing my hair til 2nd- 3rd dose  you sound to be coping well take care you know we are here if you need to ask or just moan
Posts.Title: A quiet hello from me!

Posts.Content: Hi I had mastectomy on 6th Aug 15 started chemo sept 9th so I didn't wait long I didn't have onc test hope you don't have to wait long and results are good take care x
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy in 2014 I am tnbc I was booked as day case I had wound glued no drain . I did have some build up of fluid which I had drained but it didn't build up overnight my chemo started 3weeks after op and I would have been OK after first dose but everyone is different . I wore sports bra with softie which I was given for comfort bc told me not to buy expensive bra til everything had settled. Tips are drink plenty of fluids , I sucked pineapple peices while having chemo helps prevent sore mouth , rest when you feel the need and look after yourself try and eat small amounts take drugs you are given , get a good thermometer , do post op exercises they do help .dont know if you are having reconstruction I didn't so when I got prothesis I also got some knitted knockers for times when I wanted some softness . Hope all goes well enjoy your grandchild mine kept me going we are here if you need to moan or need to ask anything
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - any advice please?

Posts.Content: Definetly ear plugs some juice water is rubbish I find I took some no talc from asda baby range I found it cooling on my skin .i find I can't concentrate on books so I took plenty of mags don't know how lucky ng you going to be in but dry shampoo if you can't get to wash hair hope all goes well
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Thanks chriistaljuju hope you ok x
Posts.Title: 2 years - mammogram - received letter for tests

Posts.Content: Hi know how you are feeling I have had pain in shoulder and arm not mastectomy site have to go for X-Ray next week I finished chemo Jan 15 it's never ending isn't it good luck x
Posts.Title: 2 years - mammogram - received letter for tests

Posts.Content: Good luck for Thursday penfold
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: I was having probs posting hope I am doing it  ok now moderated let me know if not I am a bit thick at times
Posts.Title: Am I posting correctly

Posts.Content: Hi was same but my temp didn't go up it was all over the place but went very low at times throughout the day this was after 2nd tax the only reason I rung hospital was I didn't feel right not I'll just not right I was neutropenic so please be aware it's not just high temp although that is to watch too. I was fine on EC . I was given paxitaxol weekly for my last dose that was  18mths ago I have slight perifral neurothropy Iin fingers and toes take care all
Posts.Title: Oh Boy ! Fell At The First Taxotere Hurdle !!

Posts.Content: I had RT mastectomy 3yrs ago and have had several knitted knockers including a swim one I can recommend them they are very comfy I wear makeup ne regularly . DEN
Posts.Title: I've made my mind up!

Posts.Content: Blooming predicted text should say I wear mine regularly.DEN
Posts.Title: I've made my mind up!

Posts.Content: hi went to see surgeon regarding blood collection under mastectomy scar he said unless it became a Lot bigger he couldn't do anything as having op to clear blood clots out does not guarentee it wouldn't return . So pain killers and anti inflamitery cream only thing . He has offered to tidy end of scar under a local as it's very untidy I am disappointed I know could be worse but discomfort and pain is a constant reminder of op plus I don't want to take painkillers forever sorry for moan hope everyone having a good day
Posts.Title: Blood collection under scar

Posts.Content: Hi mar gym how you doing  I have had blood drained but they struggled to. Withdraw much I have finished treatment I was triple neg so only chemo after mastectomy I will just have to hope that it may settle there is a lot worse off take care xx
Posts.Title: Blood collection under scar

Posts.Content: I was told 2years at least recovery I finished chemo jan15 and still have days where joints ache and I feel generally tired hope yours doesn't last as long take care
Posts.Title: 1 yr post chemo is this normal?

Posts.Content: I was told 2years at least recovery I finished chemo jan15 and still have days where joints ache and I feel generally tired hope yours doesn't last as long take care
Posts.Title: 1 yr post chemo is this normal?

Posts.Content: Did you have chemo last time and what if you did
Posts.Title: Lump on Rib after Double Mastectomy

Posts.Content: That is really bad luck Taylor has a plan of treatment been put in place yet if not I hope it won't be long before you get on with attacking recurrence x
Posts.Title: Lump on Rib after Double Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I lost my father when I was 4 I only know he died of heart probs it must be more worrying for you with your mum being very young . Contact your breast care nurse she can surely make sure appt is not delayed even if they don't remember you they can obtain your records hope your suspicitions unfounded take care
Posts.Title: Lump on Rib after Double Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear your horrible news there's not much I can say but my thoughts are with you and fingers crossed it asnt spread best wishes to you and your family
Posts.Title: Lump on Rib after Double Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Always Baking So glad l'm saying this ..... 6 months Chemo's are now behind me.  Had last one on Thursday, and the staff clapped me out, and l emotionally rang that bell !   Surgery will l presume be new year (but the scan will b interesting as neither me nor my olcologist can feel the malteser that was there in April when finding it raised the alarm ! )    lt's a bit too early after my last Chemo, but its the only chance l've got to have few days away...so l'm off the Ireland for few days. next Thurs.    The hosp have advised m re face mask for flights and asprin  for 3 days around flights both ways etc.  But wondered if l could pos get a disabled pass l can stick on my hire car for when l'm there (incase l'm feling wobbly if l cant partk near where l want to be)   l go on Thurs, so havnt got time to apply for proper disabled badge (and dont want one)  Just a temp thing for next week and  Xmas hire car Invernss - Skye.  Wondered if my GP could help with something.  Any advise would be really helpful  xx
Posts.Title: Chemo's finished !!

Posts.Content: Well done on finishing chemo , have a good time in Ireland,sorry can't help with badge must admit didn't think about  when I was struggling with mobility hope you get something sorted
Posts.Title: Chemo's finished !!

Posts.Content: Hi spiced tea I had slight neurothropy following chemo beginning 2015 my fingers still feel tingly and toes are a bit numb and feel strange it doesn't stop me doing things but I find walking down steps is a bit frightening at times have to come down one at a time which makes me feel old and I feel I am holding people up especially in train stations where people are rushing so I now use lifts to go down hope yours settles mine became more noticeable after chemo .DEN
Posts.Title: Peripheral sensory neuropathy: how bad should it be allowed to get...

Posts.Content: Hi spiced tea I had slight neurothropy following chemo beginning 2015 my fingers still feel tingly and toes are a bit numb and feel strange it doesn't stop me doing things but I find walking down steps is a bit frightening at times have to come down one at a time which makes me feel old and I feel I am holding people up especially in train stations where people are rushing so I now use lifts to go down hope yours settles mine became more noticeable after chemo .DEN
Posts.Title: Peripheral sensory neuropathy: how bad should it be allowed to get...

Posts.Content: I hope you and your family have a better year this time you are one strong lady but we can only take so much . Glad to hear news regarding gd was good . Remember tears are not a sign of weakness they are a safety valve best wishes to you and your family
Posts.Title: Will it ever end?!

Posts.Content: Hi I found injection S/E the worst pain ever I couldn't walk some days I ended up in hospital with fluctuating temp I had neutropenia but temp never raised onc changed my last tax to four weeks paxitaxol which is easier on body so inj not needed chemo went on longer but it was manageable for me hope you feeling better
Posts.Title: Day 4 visit to hospital

Posts.Content: Hi glad you feeling ok following mastectomy I had mine last August had seroma prior to chemo finished in January no further treatment as triple neg are you having chemo now xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy, a week on

Posts.Content: Hi antsy plum hope all goes well re appt in October waiting is the worst time try not to worry too much it won't change things let us know how you get on x
